result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer C Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 13 Days were granted if imposed.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF1496

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to posters.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Court deems the $401.00 seized by the City of Waukesha Police Dept, from case 15CF1103 as contraband and orders the money to be forfeited by City of Waukesha Police Dept.

Cases 14CM2304, 14CM2305, 15CM1615 and 15CF1103 were dismissed and read in. No Contact with William or Kyle Lewis and Mitchell Shepherd. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (ie, bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Release for standard conditions. To report by 10am on 04/21/2016. LAST 65 days are Stayed for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
13 Days Credit.
Concurrent to case:  15CF1496.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to case:  15CF1496
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Contact with:  William or Kyle Lewis and Mitchell Shepherd.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail and refund balance to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 60 Days to be served.
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 10 am. on:  04/21/16
Balance STAYED - To be used at the agent's discretion.

 
Court deems the $401 seized by the City of Waukesha Police Department (from case 15CF1103) as contraband, and orders the $401 forfeited to the City of Waukesha Police Department.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
